creator: melker@jazzfree.com
text:
After installing Apache 2.0.39, the server starts up fine. But 
stopping/restarting the server with the start menu shortcuts or the 
new "monitor" or is not possible for me, because the process seems to hang. 
Looking then at the services panel, Apache is "Stopping" forever. The only way 
to restart the server is to restart the whole machine! I'm running Win2k 
Service pack 2, and haven't had any problems with the 1.3.XX versions of 
Apache. Hasn't anyone experienced the same problems?

Maximilian.
What modules do you have loaded, in addition to the defaults?
creator: wrowe@apache.org
melker@jazzfree.com
text: No additional modules loaded. I just did a default install.

creator: dpejesh@yahoo.com
text: Do you have any firewall software installed?

creator: melker@jazzfree.com
text:
I do normally use ZoneAlarm, but not when installing software ;-) Now, I've 
even tried removing the firewall altogether, just in case.

After a couple of new attempts, I found that just after installing the Apache 
server it is possible to restart and stop/start, but after restarting the whole 
machine, the server will always hang again if I try to stop it. The mySQL 
connection on localhost (just after restarting the system) isn't possible 
either, as it was just after the install.

Hasn't ANYONE run into the same problem? I mean, I'm not the only one running 
this thingy on Win2000??

I suspect your problem is attributed to ZoneAlarm.  I'm going to mark this as a
duplicate, but if you feel that ZoneAlarm isn't the culprit feel free to reopen
this report.
